description: SUPPLY AND DELIVERY OF 205 LAPTOPS FOR PERIOD OF TWELVE (12) MONTHS
conditions:
Only bidders accredited under SITA Contract RFB 740 2021/05/24 – 2024/05/24, Gauteng province will be considered.  This requirement is in line with Regulations 15 on SITA regulations “Departments must for use in a province, procure from service providers located in the province concerned to ensure optimal spending in that province.”

Bidders must attach proof of SITA accreditation.

Any bidder that does not comply with the above mandatory criteria for pre-qualification will be eliminated and will not be considered further in the evaluation process.
reason:
In the application, the DCS explains that the initial tender for the supply and delivery of 205 
laptops for a period of twelve (12) months was cancelled due to the PPR 2017 being declared 
invalid by the Constitutional Court. The tender was re-advertised for the second time on the 
15th of July 2022 with a closing date of 5 August 2022. it is however indicated that all the 
received tenders were non-responsive, which prompted the need for the second cancellation.

The manufacture and supply of Ready board and Pole-top box within the
Limlanga Cluster
briefingVenue: Click here to join the meeting
reason:
A formal open tender number LP0078JK was issued, as supported by an approved contract strategy
by the Dual Adjudicator Ms. Pumezile Makeba on the 26th of June 2022. A formal open tender was
issued for 22 calendar days and published through the Eskom Tender Bulletin and National
Treasury’s e-tendering portal on 27 June 2022 with the closing date of 19 July 2022.
A non-Compulsory clarification meeting was held with suppliers on 07 July 2022.During that meeting
the Quality Representative took the suppliers through the quality tender returnables. The suppliers
wanted to clarify if an ISO Certificate would be fine or if they should complete Section A and provide
all supporting documents. The Quality representative explained that ISO9001-2015, is fine but it must
be the correct ISO that was requested, suppliers to still complete and comply with Section B and the
rest of the documents. Clarity on the delivery was discussed and suppliers wanted to know if can
provide delivery for the required material. The response was that delivery would be carried out by
ERI.
The Technical representative also got the opportunity to take suppliers through the technical
returnables. The suppliers also wanted to know if they must deliver samples together with the tender
request, the response was that samples would be requested just before the granting the order. After
clarification meeting held on 07 July 2022 the technical representative sent Standard criteria to be added as part of the technical pack. It was then included as part of the tender returnables and posted
on the tender bulletins.
The technical evaluation team did evaluations on 10 August 2022, but the SME realized that technical
requirements issued with the tender were incomplete and the team could therefore not proceed with
evaluations as this posed a risk to Eskom. The SME was however not part of the SI Team that
prepared the initial technical requirements.
Based on the above reason, the tender should be cancelled due to Improper / unrealistic
specifications and functionality criteria in the enquiry document. The tender will be reissued

description: THE REFURBISHMENT OF FOUR COOLING TOWERS (I.E. COOLING TOWERS (2, 3, 4 & 5) AT TUTUKA POWER STATION.
briefingVenue: Tutuka Power Station Outside Conference Boardroom
reason:
CANCELLATION FOR ENQUIRY NUMBER: MWP1423GX
Dear Sir/ Madam
After careful deliberation, we regret to advise that Eskom Holdings SOC Limited would like to
cancel the tender for Refurbishment of four Cooling Towers (I.E cooling tower 2, 3, 4. & 5 ) for
Tutuka Power Station due to the following reason:
In terms of Eskom’s Procurement and Supply Chaim Management Procedure 32-1034 Rev 4,
clause 14.7.6, (Cancellation of, and Re-Issuing of an Enquiry) states that Cancellation / reissuing
of enquiries may occur at any time after the enquiry has been issued to the market
and before contract award.
Sub paragraph 3 states the following which are applicable to the reason for cancelling this
tender:
a) Improper / unrealistic specifications and functionality criteria in the enquiry
document.
Eskom would like to take the opportunity to thank you for participation in the above.
Regards

description: PROVISION OF PAPERTRAIL LICENSES FOR A PERIOD OF ONE YEAR
reason:
After careful consideration and deliberation of the  RFQ for provision of paper trial licenses for a period of one year, we regret to advise that Ports Regulator of South Africa (PRSA) has taken a decision to cancel the RFQ. The RFQ is cancelled due to the Constitutional Court judgement that was handed down on 30th of May 2022, regarding suspension of Preferential Procurement Regulations, 2017. Constitutional Court declared Preferential Procurement Regulations, 2017 valid in their entirety until 15 February 2023 or unless the new regulations are promulgated before that date. 
National Treasury advised all organs of state to decide whether to withdraw or not any quotations or tenders advertised before 30th of May 2022 in light of the above judgement and request new quotations that will be subjected to the 2017 Regulations. Therefore, PRSA decided to exercise this option and withdraw the above-mentioned RFQ.

APPOINTMENT OF SERVICE PROVIDER(S) TO RENDER PROJECT MANAGEMENT SERVICES FOR THE EMPLOYMENT OF 2451 COMMUNITY MEMBERS IN LIMPOPO AND EASTERN CAPE PROVINCES TO PARTICIPATE IN THE BIODIVERSITY ECONOMY – SUPPORT FOR 19 TRADITIONAL AUTHORITIES PROJECT AS PART OF THE PRESIDENTIAL ECONOMIC STIMULUS PACKAGE FOR A DURATION OF SIX (6) MONTHS
reason:
This tender was advertised after 16 February 2022. In light of the 
Constitutional Court judgment dated 16 February 2022 which found the Preferential 
Procurement Regulations invalid, National Treasury advised Departments to keep on hold 
tenders advertised on or after 16 February 2022. The reason for this being that the 
Constitutional Court did not expressly state whether the invalidity of the Regulations was 
effective immediately or whether a 12 months suspension would apply. National Treasury 
requested clarity from Constitutional Court and up to this point, there has not been confirmation 
by National Treasury as to whether such clarity was provided.

Constitutional Court judgment dated 16 February 2022 which found the Preferential 
Procurement Regulations invalid, National Treasury advised Departments to keep on hold 
tenders advertised on or after 16 February 2022. The reason for this being that the 
Constitutional Court did not expressly state whether the invalidity of the Regulations was 
effective immediately or whether a 12 months suspension would apply. National Treasury 
requested clarity from Constitutional Court and up to this point, there has not been confirmation 
by National Treasury as to whether such clarity was provided. T

delivery: Various Transmission Grids - Various Transmission Grids - Various Transmission Grids - 4001
category: Repair and installation of machinery and equipment
description:
Repair/Calibration of Condition Monitoring Equipment for the period of
three years for: South, Central, North West, West, North, North East and
East Grid, Transmission
briefingVenue: MS Teams _ Link available on the Invitation to tender
reason:
REQUEST TO RE-ISSUE A TENDER
In accordance with the latest revision of Eskom’s Procurement and Supply Chain Management Procedure 32-1034, permission is requested to cancel and re-issue tender enquiry No. WC1015TK for the repairs and calibration of condition monitoring equipment for various grids in Transmission for a period of 36 months.
2. BACKGROUND
High Voltage Plant (HVP) within all the Transmission Grids is responsible for, among others, the monitoring of all high voltage equipment in the high voltage yards. As such, there are specialized equipment that is used to conduct this work and the technicians then produce reports from their findings and suggest the most appropriate recommendations to the business.
Various purchase requisitions were sent to the Procurement Department via the SAP system. The procurement mechanism selected to enable this purchase is that of open tendering where an enquiry was issued on the 14 February 2022 closing on the 08 March 2022. A clarification meeting was held on the 28 February 2022 via Ms Teams, no external parties attended the meeting. No response was received after tender close, and this was communicated by the Risk and Governance tender office.
RECOMMENDATION
It is recommended that approval be granted to cancel and re-issue enquiry No WC1015TK in order to conclude a contract for the repairs and calibration for Condition Monitoring Equipment for Various Grids in Transmission for a period of 36 months

delivery: No. 60 Voortrekker Road - Bellville, Cape town - Bellville - 7535
category: Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning
description: The Supply and Delivery of SF6 Optical Camera and Accessories for the Transmission Western Grid
reason:
1.	REQUEST TO RE-ISSUE A TENDER

In accordance with the latest revision of Eskom’s Procurement and Supply Chain Management Procedure 32-1034, permission is requested to cancel and re-issue tender enquiry No WC1010TK for The Supply and Delivery of SF6 Optical Camera and Accessories for the Transmission Western Grid. 

2.	BACKGROUND 

The need for the Test equipment originates from Transmission. The SF6 Gas detection camera is to effectively ensure that SF6 gas leaks on installed equipment is correctly identified on Gas Insulated installations and to ensure that the repair method can be planned correctly. Furthermore, the identification of gas leaks while plant is in operation reduces down time and ensures that plant can be out of service for shorter periods of time.

For the Infra red camera it assist the operator to detect hot spots on terminal and bay equipment before and after operating takes place. This reduces the risk of plant failure.

The above purchase requisitions was sent to the Procurement Department via the SAP system. The procurement mechanism selected to enable this purchase is that of open tendering were an enquiry was issued on the 07 February 2022 closing on the 01 March 2022. No clarification meeting was held as this non-complex off the shelf equipment. 

Only one tenderer was received from the market, and was disqualified because of the pre-qualification criteria which request suppliers with a BBB-EE status level of contributor of EME & QSE 1 – 2. Based on this finding, Eskom is looking to open the enquiry to all suppliers without applying the pre-qualification criteria. 


RECOMMENDATION

It is recommended that approval be granted to cancel and re-issue enquiry No WC1010TK in order to conclude a contract for The Supply and Delivery of SF6 Optical Camera and Accessories for the Transmission Western Grid.

delivery: 8 van Niekerk Street - Sonheuwel Central - Mbombela - 1201
description:
NOTICE AND INVITATION TO BID

EDM/26/2021-22 

CONSTRUCTION OF WATER SUPPLY AT GOROMANE VILLAGE IN BUSHBUCKRIDGE LOCAL MUNICIPALITY

EHLANZENI DISTRICT MUNICIPALITY HEREBY INVITES BIDS FOR THE ABOVE-MENTIONED TENDER



Only bidders who have provided the following mandatory information and documents to be used to evaluate the bidder's responsiveness will be considered for further evaluation on functionality:
•	Central Supplier Database (CSD) Registration Report.
•	Valid SARS PIN.
•	Certified company registration documents from the Companies and Intellectual Property Commission (CIPC) and bidders must attach certified copies of shareholder’s certificates where applicable.
•	Certified copies of identity documents of company directors.
•	Joint Venture or Consortium Agreement if applicable.
•	Certified copy or copies of municipal account/s not older than three months for both the bidder and the company directors or lease agreement or proof of residence (PTO) from the relevant traditional authority.
•	Fully completed tender document as issued and signed.
•	The bid comprises of local content and production for designated sectors such as locally produced or locally manufactured steel products (100%), PVC pipes (100%), and both valves and pumps (70%) prospective service provider are required by law to properly and correctly complete the MBD 6.2 with Annexures C, D and E (Local production and Content). Failure to complete these documents will lead to automatic disqualification as the bid be considered non-responsiveness.
•	CIDB grading of 4EC or higher.
Received bids will be evaluated for responsiveness based on mandatory requirements, functionality with a minimum threshold of 65 points out of a possible 100 points, and price and B-BBEE status level of contribution in accordance with the criteria stipulated on the bid or tender documents in line with the provisions of the Preferential Procurement Regulations, 2017.
Bid documents can be viewed and downloaded at no cost on the Document Sharing and Collaboration Platform or Portal (NEPTUNE): http://edmservices.ehlanzeni.gov.za and National Treasury Portal from Wednesday, 26 January 2022. Further information regarding the downloading and uploading of documents will be explained in the virtual briefing session.
A compulsory briefing session will be held on Wednesday, 2 February 2022, 10H00 at Ehlanzeni Disaster Management and Conference Centre, 8 van Niekerk Street, Sonheuwel Central, Mbombela, 1200.
Where bids should be submitted - Completed bid and other returnable documents must be submitted only in PDF format on the Document Sharing and Collaboration Platform or Portal: http://edmservices.ehlanzeni.gov.za  on or before Tuesday, 8 February 2022 not later than 12H00.
Enquiries:	Contact Person - ADMINISTRATION:  Mr. P Khumalo at 013 759 8-573 or pkhumalo@ehlanzeni.gov.za
		Contact Person – TECHNICAL: Mr. T Sambo at 013 759 8500 or tsotetsi@ehlanzeni.gov.za 

F S SIBOZA
MUNICIPAL MANAGER
briefingVenue: Ehlanzeni Disaster Management and Conference Centre

description:
Public Relations - PR agencies promote companies or their campaigns via editorial and media coverage.  This is known as "earned" or "free" media (stories appearing on digital platforms, newspapers, magazines, and TV channels) in contrast to "paid media" or advertisements. A strong PR agency will advise leadership in times of crisis and guide the business through challenging times to minimise any negative reputational impact, by using its industry associations to generate the all-important earned media. The agency will also provide media training, generate media releases, and generate positive newsworthy material from the company’s activities. The PR agency will also need established connections and supplier lists for each region in the country. The PR agency will need these industry associations so that it can plan, execute, and manage events, community activations, roadshows, exhibitions, conferences, and any other type of event.   

•	Account management
•	Public relations strategy
•	Campaign media relations
•	Public relations collateral/content development
•	Reputation management
•	Issues and crisis management
•	Media training
•	Ideation of activations in support of Eskom campaigns
•	Full activation management services
conditions:

delivery: 8 van Niekerk Street - Sonheuwel Central - Mbombela - 1200
description:
EHLANZENI DISTRICT MUNICIPALITY HEREBY INVITES PROSPECTIVE BIDDERS FOR THE BELOW-MENTIONED TENDERS TO PROVIDE PROFESSIONAL SERVICES FOR THE COMPILATION OF A WASTEWATER TREATMENT WORKS IMPROVEMENT PROGRAMME AND IMPLEMENTATION FOR THABA CHWEU LOCAL MUNICIAPLITY
Only bidders who have provided the following mandatory information and documents to be used to evaluate the bidder's responsiveness will be considered for further evaluation on functionality:
•	Central Supplier Database (CSD) Registration Report
•	Valid SARS PIN
•	Certified company registration documents from the Companies and Intellectual Property Commission (CIPC) and bidders must attach certified copies of shareholder’s certificates where applicable.
•	Certified copies of identity documents of company directors
•	Joint Venture or Consortium Agreement if applicable
•	Fully completed tender document as issued and signed
•	The bid comprises of local content and production for designated sectors such as locally produced or locally manufactured steel products (100%), and prospective service providers are required by law to complete the MBD 6.2 with its Templates- Annexures C, D and E (Local production), failure to complete the documents will lead to automatic disqualification as the bid will be considered non responsive.
Received bids will be evaluated on responsiveness based on mandatory requirements, functionality with a minimum threshold of 70 points, and price and B-BBEE status level of contribution in accordance with the criteria stipulated on the bid or tender documents in line with the provisions of the Preferential Procurement Regulations, 2017.
Bid documents can be viewed and downloaded at no cost on the Document Sharing and Collaboration Platform or Portal (NEPTUNE): http://edmservices.ehlanzeni.gov.za from Friday, 22 October 2021. Further information regarding the downloading and uploading of documents will be explained in the virtual briefing session.
Where bids should be submitted - Completed bid and other returnable documents must be submitted only in PDF format on the Document Sharing and Collaboration Platform or Portal: http://edmservices.ehlanzeni.gov.za  on or before the Tuesday, 3 November 2021 on or before 12H00.
A virtual non-compulsory briefing session will be held on Tuesday, 26 October at 12H00 and in order to connect follow the link: Join Zoom Meeting at https://zoom.us/j/92339061239?pwd=YlQwQXNRanFld1YxdGV3YTE2d3h3QT09 
Enquiries:	Contact Person - ADMINISTRATION:  Mr P Khumalo at 013 759 8-573 or pkhumalo@ehlanzeni.gov.za

conditions: Refer to the tender documentation for prescribed special conditions.
reason:
RE: INVITATION TO TENDER CORP5535


Dear Sir/ Madam


Kindly refer to the above subject.	


After careful deliberation, we regret to advise that Eskom Holdings SOC Limited would like to cancel the tender for the Maintenance and Repair Services for the currently installed System Operator Rear Projection (Mapboard) System on an As and When required basis for a period of 36 months- due to the following reason/s: 

•	Out of the two (2) tenders that were received, one tender was deemed technically non-compliant, and the second tenderer could not extend their tender validity which makes them non-responsive. 

Eskom would like to take the opportunity to thank you for participation in the above.

The need for the service remains and the tender will be issued again soon via the Formal Competitive Tendering Process. 


Yours Faithfully

c)	No acceptable bids were received. 

2.	That the following bidders was found to be non-responsive:

NON-RESPONSIVE TENDERS 
(after compliance with specifications, conditions, special conditions and functionality)
1	NORMAN WAIT/GARAGE MAN	T1.2: TENDER DATA
Only those tenderers who are registered with the CIDB or are capable of being so prior to the evaluation of submissions, in a contractor grading designation equal to or higher than a contractor grading designation determined in accordance with the sum tendered, or a value determined in accordance with Regulation 25 (1B) or 25(7A) of the Construction Industry Development Regulations, for a 1EB or higher class of construction work, are eligible to have their tenders evaluated.
Joint ventures are eligible to submit tenders provided that:
1.	every member of the joint venture is registered with the CIDB;
2.	the lead partner has a contractor grading designation in the 1EB or higher class of construction work

The bidder has a CIDB grading of 1SQ, therefore does not have the required CIDB grading in the 1EB or higher class. The bidder is therefore found to be non-responsive.

SECTION 2.3: FUNCTIONALITY EVALUATION CRITERIA
A bidder that scores less than 70 points out of 100 in respect of “functionality” will be regarded as submitting a non-responsive proposal and will be disqualified.

The bidder scored a total of 50 out of 100 points for functionality and is therefore found to be non-responsive.

briefingVenue: Link to be requested from departmental officials.
reason: On Wednesday, 16 February 2022 at 10h00, the Constitutional Court handed down judgment in the application for leave to appeal against a judgment and order of the Supreme Court of Appeal.  This application was brought by the Minister of Finance (Minister) against Afribusiness NPC, and concerns the validity of the Preferential Procurement Regulations, 2017 (Procurement Regulations) promulgated by the Minister on 20 January 2017 in terms of Section 5 of the Preferential Procurement Policy Framework Act (Procurement Act).  Consequently, the National Treasury (NT) issued Instruction Notes dated 25 February 2022 and 03 March 2022 advising on suspension of procurement activities for expenditure above R30 000.00.  The National Treasury (NT) letter dated 03 March 2022, further states that the Departments can apply for the exemption to the Minister of Finance seeking approval to proceed with procurement activities that are critical.  The Department did not conclude this bid based on the reasons provided above.

description: CONSTRUCTION HEALTH & SAFETY SERVICES FOR A PERIOD OF THREE (3) YEARS
reason:
1.	It is recommended that Tender HES-TECH 01/2122: Construction Health & Safety services for a period of three (3) years be cancelled as per Preferential Procurement Regulations 2017 paragraph 13 (1) (d)

d) there is a material irregularity in the tender process. 
Please see the technical department’s motivation for cancellation below:
There was a condition in the tender that bidders must submit their bank rating from their respective banks. Obtaining the bank ratings from various bidders was difficult and most banks was unable to provide us with the information to score this section of functionality. 
Most of the bidders completed the pricing schedule incorrectly and huge differences exists in the rates prices provided by the various bidders. 
This cancellation of this tender does not pose a risk as all the other projects for the current year already have OHS agents. The appointment of the roads project will be done in terms of a closed quotation process. 
The pricing and functionality will be re-visited, and a compulsory site meeting will be held to explain the functionality and completion of pricing schedule to ensure that all bidders understand how the schedule must be completed.

description: APPOINTMENT OF A SERVICE PROVIDER TO COORDINATE THE PLANNING, MANAGEMENT, AND IMPLEMENTATION OF THE CONSTRUCTION INDUSTRY SME DEVELOPMENT PROJECT FOR A PERIOD OF EIGHTEEN (18) MONTHS
reason:
Tender number	cidb/008/2122

Tender Description	: Appointment of a service provider to coordinate the planning, management, and implementation of the construction industry SME development project for a period of eighteen (18) months

Background	The above-mentioned tender was issued on 23 July 2021 on the e-tender bulletin. On the 25 August 2021, an addendum was issued to extend the tender closing date to 13 September 2021 as it was noted that the tender was published late on the cidb website.

Reason for cancellation
	There was a material irregularity in the tender process, in that the tender was not timeously published on the cidb website. This may comprise fairness and integrity of the tender. As such, the above tender is hereby cancelled.

Enquires	Name:                  Mr Sphiwe Mlangeni
e-mail address:    sphiwem@cidb.org.za
Tel number:          012 482 7328



The cidb wishes to thank you for your interest shown. We would like to apologies for any inconvenience caused by the cancellation of this tender. We hope this will not deter you from tendering in future
